claim: Joe Biden signed 50 executive orders in his first week as president.
explanation: While Biden did sign a significant number of executive orders in his first week, the actual count was 17, not 50. This was still a record number for a president's first week.

claim: The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer due to thermal expansion.

sources.title: Eiffel Tower And Science - toureiffel.paris
sources.excerpt: Yes, the tower can grow by about 15 cm in summer due to thermal expansion of the iron structure.

sources.title: Linear Expansion Coefficients D 95 - engineeringtoolbox.com
sources.excerpt: The coefficient of thermal expansion for iron is approximately 12 × 10^-6 per degree Celsius.

explanation: This claim is accurate. When exposed to heat, the iron structure of the Eiffel Tower expands. In summer, when temperatures can reach up to 40°C, the tower can grow by approximately 15 centimeters.

claim: Drinking coffee reduces the risk of type 2 diabetes by exactly 30%.

sources.title: 24458103 - pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov
sources.excerpt: A 2014 meta-analysis found coffee consumption was associated with a 30% lower risk.

sources.title: 29276945 - pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov
sources.excerpt: A 2018 study reported a 20% reduction in risk per cup consumed daily.

sources.title: Coffee And Diabetes - diabetes.org
sources.excerpt: Results vary significantly across studies depending on population, coffee type, and consumption patterns.

explanation: Multiple studies have shown that coffee consumption is associated with reduced diabetes risk, but the exact percentage varies widely across studies (ranging from 20-35%). Claiming an exact 30% reduction cherry-picks from specific studies and doesn't represent the full evidence base.
